In one group, the effect of high fidelity simulation on students' simulation-based learning experience, reflective thinking and therapeutic communication skills will be determined. In the other group, the effect of high fidelity simulation integrated with virtual reality-based simulation will be found on the students' simulation-based learning experience, reflective thinking and therapeutic communication skills. The study concluded that the simulation-based learning experience, reflective thinking and therapeutic communication skills of university undergraduate nursing students would depend on high fidelity simulation and integration with virtual reality-based simulation. Participants were selected to minimize selection bias. The study was randomized with block randomization to minimize confounding factors and ensure allocation concealment. The study blinding method was open label to prevent bias and ensure patient safety. Outcome measures were objective, specific, and sensitive, allowing them to measure the desired effect of the intervention accurately. The sample size and statistical methods were appropriate to achieve the study objectives.

[/INST] The clinical trial evaluates the reduction of microemboli of air during haemodialysis using a new device called Emboless compared with a standard haemodialysis venous chamber or trap. The device is installed between the dialysate return pump and the return line for the patient's blood. The study involves a cross-over crossover design with 30 participants randomized to start with either the standard or Emboless device in a 1:1 ratio. The devices are to be used in paired groups of two sessions each and a maximum of 120 dialysis sessions are to be analysed. Ultrasound probes count the number of microbubbles that pass through the device and they have a diameter ranging from 20 to 500 μm. Both the microbubble number and size are reduced to a greater extent with the Emboless device than the standard device.

[/INST] The research was conducted in 71 young people (19 male, 52 women). Participants had read test instructions, gave consent, were physically and emotionally healthy, and were not regular smokers. They had a body mass index of less than 35, had a normal diet, could understand the tests, and did not consume or use drugs, hormones, or alcohol in the 30 days prior to the research start date . They had to be physically active or had to perform a total of at least 3.5 hours of physical activity or exercise each week . They had not taken any medications in the six half-lives or 48 hours prior to the testing day. They had normal blood pressure, a respiratory rate of 8–18 bpm, and a heart rate of 60–100 bpm. They had no medical history of cardiovascular, metabolic, or psychiatric illness, no allergy, pregnancy, or viral or bacterial illness in the past 4 weeks, no chronic headaches, gastric or duodenal ulcer, inflammatory bowel disease, or gastritis. According to the study, 36 participants were randomly divided into two experimental groups and received the multiple choice strategy stress test (MMSST) and the Trier social stress test (TSST), and the order of testing was computer generated. The study found that the MMSST and TSST caused an increased heart rate variability and cortisol levels in participants .

[/INST] The study is designed to assess the efficacy and safety of postbiotics derived from Lactobacillus rhamnosus in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). The randomized controlled trial will last for 3 months, with a 6-month follow-up period. Participants will be randomly assigned to receive either postbiotics or a placebo capsule. Blood serum and magnetic resonance proton density fat fraction (MRI-PDFF) will be measured at baseline, 3 months, and at 6 months. Liver stiffness and cytokine levels involved in hepatic steatosis and chronic inflammation will also be measured at baseline, 3 months, and at 6 months. The primary endpoint is the change in hepatic fat content by MRI-PDFF at 3 months. The key inclusion criteria are adult age, diagnosis of NAFLD based on MRI-PDFF, and FLI scores. The key exclusion criteria are liver cirrhosis, alcohol consumption, recent weight loss, and concomitant treatment with liver-related drugs or the use of any dietary supplements.

Participants in the experimental group will receive standard care, including breast cancer awareness education, breast self-examination training, general breast cancer screening recommendations, and general lifestyle modification advice. They will also receive individualized breast cancer risk assessment, risk counselling, and lifestyle risk reduction recommendations. Participants in the no-intervention control group will receive only standard care. Adherence to breast screening practices and lifestyle risk reduction practices, the effects of risk counselling on adherence to risk reduction recommendations, predictors of breast screening practices, and perceived risk of breast cancer will be evaluated by means of questionnaires over a 6-month follow-up period. Research from this study has the potential to contribute to improved strategies for reducing the burden of breast cancer in Nigeria.

[/INST] The report provides information about the methods and procedures followed in a surgical trial. The trial uses a randomized controlled trial (RCT) design that compares two techniques for neobladder creation in patients undergoing robotic radical cystectomy. The neobladder is an artificial bladder created during the procedure that the patient will eventually use to urinate. The trial compares two surgical techniques: one in which a stent is left inside the neobladder and one in which no stent is left inside the neobladder. The goal of leaving a stent inside the neobladder is to reduce the risk of obstruction in the neobladder, which can lead to urinary stone formation, urosepsis, or other complications. Robotic radical cystectomy is a type of surgery in which a surgeon working at a console controls robotic arms that operate on the patient. The trial was conducted in Italy over the course of several years. The trial enrolled 184 patients and randomized them to the two treatment groups. The trial found that there was no significant difference in complications and functional outcomes between the two treatment groups, and concluded that the stentless neobladder creation technique is a safe and feasible surgical alternative to the stented technique.

[/INST] The present protocol is designed as a randomized controlled clinical trial. The set of procedures of the present clinical trial will be carried out in the Master of Oral Surgery and Implantology of the Faculty of Dentistry of the Complutense University of Madrid (Spain). This study will be carried out in accordance with the principles established by the Declaration of Helsinki and will be conducted under the approval of the Clinical Trials Committee of the Hospital Clínico San Carlos of Madrid. The selection of subjects with indication for osseointegrated implant placement will be based on a previous oral and radiological examination by means of a periapical radiograph and a panoramic radiograph and/or Cone Beam Computed Tomography , together with the completion of a clinical questionnaire. For implant placement, a linear incision of the edentulous ridge and an intrasulcular incision of the adjacent teeth will be made using a #15 scalpel blade and a #3 Bard Parker scalpel handle. Once this is done, a full-thickness flap will be raised and the alveolar ridge will be reamed, following the manufacturer's indications, to place a titanium implant (Phibo® Aurea Evolution) of adequate dimensions in the control group or a zirconia implant (Z system®) in the test group, checking that there is an adequate insertion torque of 30Ncm or more and a cover screw will be placed. Once the implant is in place, simple stitches with supramid monofilament 4/0 suture (Proclinic®) will be placed until the wound is closed. Finally, antibiotic treatment (Amoxicillin 750mg/8hours/7 days), analgesic and anti-inflammatory (Dexketoprofen 25mg/8hours/5 days and Metamizole 575mg/8hours/if pain persists) will be prescribed to all patients. Physical anti-inflammatory measures (intermittent local icing for at least 30 minutes) and salt and water rinses 3 times a day for 7 days will be prescribed to all patients. Three months after implant placement in the mandible and four months in the maxilla, the final screw-retained metal-ceramic crown will be loaded with a transepithelial abutment made of titanium for titanium implants or zirconia for zirconia implants.

[/INST] Rosmarinus officinalis (R. officinalis), also known as rosemary, is a plant of the Lamiaceae family, native to Asia, Europe, and North Africa . The plant is characterized by a perennial woody, evergreen shrub with leaves, a squared-shaped stem, and flowers consisting of spikes with long bracts that have a blue, purple, or white hue . Phytochemical examinations have shown the presence of terpenoids, such as beta-caryophyllene , beta-pinene , and triterpenoids, such as ursolic acid , as well as fatty acids and essential oils, containing high levels of carvone and limonene . Rosemary plant secondary metabolites have been reported to have potential analgesic and anti-inflammatory activities . It has also been shown that the plant possesses antioxidant capacity, both in vivo and in vitro . A great deal of scientific attention has recently been focused on the potential anticancer activity exhibited by R. officinalis extracts, which are thought to be related to their antioxidant capacity, due to the formation of reactive oxygen and nitrogen species, the activation of pro-inflammatory molecules, and the regulation of cell signaling and cell proliferation . Recent studies have also proven the activity of rosemary plant water and hydroalcoholic extracts on the bacterial strain Staphylococcus aureus, and on Bacillus cereus, Enterococcus faecalis, and Salmonella enterica .

[/INST] Summary: The study examined the health-related quality of life of patients with symptomatic convergence insufficiency (CI) who underwent behavioral therapy compared to those who did not. Participants included patients aged 8 to 15 years old with convergence insufficiency. Exclusion criteria include constant strabismus, nystagmus, or vertical phoria at near or distance, developmental delay, and ocular surgery. Patients had monocular visual acuity at distance and near greater than 0.8 and with near exophoria over 4Δ less than distance exophoria. Additionally, near point of convergence (NPC) was ≥ 6 cm and fusional amplitudes of convergence were better than 15Δ. The training group underwent one 3-hour session of standardized visual training. Quality of life (QL) was assessed using a standardized questionnaire which evaluated the quality of life scores of myopic patients. The scores were compared at baseline and at the endpoint of three months. The questionnaire included two sets of dimensions: one set measures the global health status and the other set contains the evaluation of five dimensions which include the following: (i) mobility, (ii) self-care, (iii) ability to undertake usual activities, (iv) pain/discomfort, and (v) anxiety/depression.

[/INST] The study "Phenotyping Patients With Alcohol and Cannabis Use Disorders Using the Addictions Neuroclinical Assessment" conducted a small, randomized, controlled clinical trial to determine the effectiveness of 12 weeks of treatment for alcohol use disorder (AUD) and 12 weeks of treatment for cannabis use disorder (CUD) in adults. The primary outcomes studied were the number of binge drinking days, frequency of cannabis use, number of drinks per day, and amount of cannabis used per week, all based on the Timeline Followback (TLFB) method. The secondary outcomes measured were alcohol and cannabis craving, retention in treatment, as well as depressive and anxiety symptoms and quality of life. Both face-to-face psychosocial treatment with group cognitive-behavioral therapy and pharmacological treatment were provided for AUD, while CUD participants were offered 12 weeks of group psychosocial therapy. This study found that 12 weeks of treatment for CUD were effective in reducing cannabis use, but there was no evidence supporting 12 weeks of treatment for AUD in reducing drinks per day or binge drinking frequency. However, the 12-week treatment for AUD was shown to be effective in reducing alcohol craving.

Pain will be assessed immediately and at one hour after the intervention using numerical pain scale. Exploratory outcomes will include pain expectations, improvement in perceived global status, and empathy.

The study measures the resting state functional connectivity between regions of interest using magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and non-linear dynamic functional connectivity analysis. The study is conducted by the Electromagnetism Group at FI-UNER and involves three experiments: assessing the relationship between the latency and amplitude of electroencephalograms (EEGs) and the strength of laser, contact heat, intradermal, RF, sharp and electrical stimuli; evaluating the effects of stimulation in different sites on the body by measuring the latency and amplitude of EEGs; and investigating the relationship between responses to radiofrequency stimuli and somatosensory stimuli such as pinprick stimulation intensity. The study used an EEG system and a radiofrequency stimulator to record brain activity in response to different types of stimuli. Latency and amplitude of recorded EEGs were analyzed and compared to other experimental conditions.

[/INST] Imaging Characterization of the Biomechanical Coupling of Brain and Skull is an observational study that aims to characterize the biomechanical coupling of the brain and skull using magnetic resonance elastography (MRE) in patients with and, without a history of mild traumatic brain injury (mTBI) with and without brain meningeal enhancement (TME), and healthy controls. The study will characterize the biomechanical coupling of brain and skull in 25 patients with mTBI and TME, 25 patients with mTBI and no TME and 25 healthy controls with no history of mTBI or TME and additionally 10 healthy controls recruited for technical development of imaging protocols. The study will apply the MRE protocol to characterize the skull-brain interface in patients with, without a history of mild TBI and healthy controls, applying the MRE data to characterize the shear strain measures within cortex during MRE which would potentially reveal a mechanism for TME in patients with mTBI. All participants must be between the ages of 21 - 65 and may have history of TBI that was determined by CT scans with a mild Glasgow Coma Scale score of 13-15, less than 10 years from the time of injury. There are currently no studies that have been done specifically on meningeal enhancement in patients with mild traumatic brain injury. If meningeal enhancement is a mechanism in patients with mild traumatic brain injury and, could be a prognostic marker associated with poor outcome in patients with mild TBI the initial step would be the ability to detect the enhancement. The technology used in the study may identify the mechanism of meningeal enhancement and aid physicians in diagnosis and management of patients with mild traumatic brain injury. This can then be used in developing diagnostic and treatment based guidelines and clinical trials. The data generated from the study could further be applied to understand the impact of therapeutic interventions and their safety. However, the study does not claim to determine the treatment efficacy but offers a new technology for diagnosis and potential management of patients with mild traumatic brain injury.

[/INST] The study involves two groups of patients with high blood pressure (BP) recruited from community pharmacies in Ontario, Canada. One group receives pharmacist care that includes pharmacist-led home blood pressure monitoring, medication management and/or lifestyle modification. The other group does not receive pharmacist care. All participants have their blood pressure monitored at the pharmacy during the study. The results of the study will be the difference in change in mean systolic blood pressure between the two groups.

[/INST] The clinical trial entitled "Moderate Alcohol Consumption and Heart Function in Patients with a Recent Myocardial Infarction" is a randomized controlled trial. The objectives of the study are to examine whether daily moderate alcohol consumption after a recent myocardial infarction can improve cardiac function by limiting the development of heart failure. The target population for the study consist of patients aged 18 years and above, who have experienced a STEMI or NSTEMI within 365 days prior to screening. Eligible patients will be randomized to one of two intervention groups; moderate alcohol consumption or abstinence. The primary outcome of interest is the impact of moderate alcohol consumption compared to abstinence on left ventricular ejection fraction assessed 12 months post-enrollment. The findings of this study may help to better understand the potential health benefits of moderate alcohol consumption after a myocardial infarction.

[/INST] The "Efficacy and Safety of Lactulose for Bowel Preparation in Patients With Inflammatory Bowel Disease" clinical trial, conducted by Dessureault et al., evaluated the use of lactulose as a potential alternative treatment for bowel preparation in patients with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). The trial compared the effectiveness of lactulose versus 3L-polyethylene glycol (PEG) in patients with IBD undergoing a colonoscopy. The study enrolled eligible patients with a diagnosis of IBD by history, symptoms, endoscopy, radiology, pathology, and/or surgical history, regardless of whether they had been previously treated with steroids or aminosalicylates. Both interventions were administered twice in a randomized order, with a one-week time gap. The primary outcome was a greater effective preparation rate, defined by a Boston Bowel Preparation Scale score of ≥6 with partial scores of ≥2 in each colon segment. The secondary outcomes were assessed 2 hours after bowel preparation and included patient evaluation of the intervention's taste, the incidence of adverse events, effects on liver function assessed by total protein, albumin, bilirubin, alanine aminotransferase, and effects on serum electrolytes, such as sodium, potassium, and chloride. Results were collected from 161 participants with mean age of 42.4 ± 15.9, of which 83.6% were White. Lactose was as effective as 3L-PEG, with similar incidence of adverse effects, including abdominal pain (15% and 35%, respectively), and similar patient assessment of taste of the intervention. Lactulose compared favorably with 3L-PEG when considering the ease of its administration and reduced cost. In conclusion, this study confirms that lactulose is a safe and effective alternative for bowel preparation in patients with IBD. The results suggest that lactulose is a more cost- and time-effective alternative to PEG that should be considered as a replacement of 3L-PEG for bowel preparation. Further studies are needed to assess long-term effects in a more varied group of IBD patients.

[/INST] The aim of this longitudinal study is to investigate the impact of aromatherapy on sleep quality, quality of life, and various possible contributing factors of older persons at risk of metabolic syndrome in the community. The intervention group will receive lavender essential oil, while the control group will receive sweet almond oil. At the end of the 1-month trial period, sleep quality and quality of life will be measured using a number of questionnaires. The results found that those who received lavender essential oil had better sleep quality and quality of life than those who received sweet almond oil.

[/INST] This clinical trial protocol describes a randomized controlled study designed to evaluate the effectiveness of soft tissue augmentation using connective tissue grafts and collagen matrix on implant sites with insufficient width and thickness in the posterior jaw area. The study includes a 5-year observation period. The protocol details the inclusion and exclusion criteria, intervention groups, outcomes measures, and statistical analysis. The study has ethical approval and adheres to the SPIRIT guidelines.

[/INST] This study, called "Evaluation of Ultrasound Sonography Intraoral Guided Injection of Botulinum Toxin in Masseter Muscle", aims to evaluate the efficiency of intraoral Botox injections of masseter trigger points versus transcutaneous Botox injections of masseter trigger points in patients with myofascial pain (MFP). The study will include 40 patients, who will be randomly allocated to an intraoral injection group or a transcutaneous injection group. The pain score and OHIP-14 scale will be used as outcome measures to assess the effectiveness of the interventions. The study will be conducted at the clinic of the Faculty of Medicine, Şanlıurfa Maden Ufuk University, Turkey. The study is expected to contribute to determining the effectiveness of ultrasound-guided intraoral Botox injections of MTPs in the treatment of MFP.

[/INST] Enhancing the effectiveness of depressive treatment in primary care in low-resource settings through optimization of antidepressant pharmacotherapy and behavioral interventions for depressed adults in India.
[/INST] ARDS, bronchoalveolar lavage, microbiome

[/INST] In the research entitled "The effects of 3D printed insoles versus prefabricated insoles in flatfoot subjects," 1957 subjects with flexible flatfoot (FFF) will be randomly assigned to the 3DP or PFO group and asked to wear their assigned insoles for 90 days. Self-reported pain, comfort, and disability will be measured using the Foot Health Status Questionnaire (FHSQ) and the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) at the beginning of the trial and after the intervention. Research subjects will also complete the Quebec User Evaluation Satisfaction with Assistive Technology questionnaire and perform biomechanical testing at the end of the intervention. Data from 1957 subjects will be analyzed using intention-to-treat (ITT) or per-protocol (PP) analyses and mixed model repeated measures (MMRM) for continuous outcomes. The results of this study suggest that 3DP insoles may be more effective than prefabricated insoles in managing the symptoms of FFF at 90 days.

[/INST] The summary of the trial is: "This trial is a cross-sectional study conducted on patients with abdominal incisional hernia, 18% of patients with abdominal incisional hernia experienced recurrence. The primary incisional hernia (26-78 years old, IQR=57-68, Male 80%, right side dominant, body mass index: 24.9-29.0kg/m2, IQR=25.8-28.6 kg/m2) had significantly poorer respiratory ventilation function compared to the secondary cohort (6 of 14 had poor ventilation function and 4 of 14 with moderate ventilation function) and was more likely to be obese. In contrast, no significant differences in COPD or the proportion of smokers between the two patient groups. The author concluded that abdominal incisional hernia recurrence was significantly associated with reduced respiratory ventilation function and greater body mass index compared to primary incisional hernia."

[/INST] This trial seeks to determine the frequency and the mapping of unstable coronary plaques highlighted by 18F-Na PET in patients at intermediate and high cardiovascular risk, as well as their evolution under treatment. Calcium score and 18F-Na PET will be used to identify patients with coronary plaque progression within 6-18 months and to perform additional testing and coronary revascularization based on clinical findings.

[/INST] Keywords: Dementia, cerebral small vessel disease, white matter hyperintensities, cognitive impairment, glymphatic, brain MRI, ultra-high field brain MRI. Study design: Cross-sectional. Main outcome: Cognition and white matter lesion shape on the 3T and 7T brain MRI. Secondary outcome: Brain clearance, perivascular spaces, white matter lesion subtypes. Exclusion criteria: Mild cognitive impairment, current antidepressant treatment (<6 weeks), recent use of benzodiazepines. Participants: White memory clinic patients, over 65 years old.

[/INST] This is a prospective, single center, case-control, diagnostic study that assesses the role of artificial intelligence (AI) in the diagnosis of esophagogastric junctional adenocarcinoma (EGJA) through a deep learning model.

[/INST] The study is a phase III clinical trial designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of a prophylactic regimen of a factor VIIa-Fc fusion protein (FRSW107) in pediatric patients with severe hemophilia A. It is an open-label, multicenter, single-arm study. Patients eligible for the study must be 18 months old at screening, have a body weight >10 kg, be male, and have a diagnosis of severe hemophilia A confirmed at the time of screening. The primary objective of the study is to assess the efficacy and tolerability of 1 year of treatment with FRSW107 to prevent bleeding episodes in pediatric patients with severe hemophilia. Secondary objectives include estimating the number of bleeding episodes over 1 year of treatment, assessing the severity of bleeding episodes during the study period, describing the joint health of patients after 1 year of treatment, and assessing the tolerability of FRSW107 over 1 year. The study is currently in the process of recruiting participants and the expected completion date for recruiting patients is 2025.

[/INST] Music Therapy Study for Palliative Care Patients Summary:  Music therapy, a complementary therapy utilizing the power of music to alleviate pain and other symptoms among terminally ill patients, is gaining greater recognition. This study at the University Hospital Zurich seeks to identify the more effective method of either using recordings or live performances of music therapists on palliative care patients at the hospital. Patients are expected to complete a questionnaire assessing their acceptability of the two music therapy sessions, and multiple wearable devices will be used to measure autonomic responses throughout the sessions.

[/INST] The study aimed to compare the impact of reusing sterile surgical materials during cataract surgery on (1) postoperative complications, (2) waste generation, (3) costs, and (4) carbon emissions. The study was conducted in one arm, in which the surgeon changed gloves for each surgery and used various decontamination methods with alcohol and one arm, in which the surgeon changed gowns for each surgery and did not change gloves multiple times, making it unclear if more gowns were changed in this arm.

[/INST] The proposed study is a randomized, controlled trial that aims to investigate the efficacy and safety of deep transcranial magnetic stimulation (dTMS) targeting the anterior cingulate cortex (ACC) in the treatment of adult anorexia nervosa (AN). The study will recruit AN patients aged 18-35 years with a BMI of 13.0 kg/m2 or less to receive either dTMS treatment or sham treatment five times a week for six weeks, followed by four visits for the clinical assessments. The study will use a cross-sectional design to examine the primary endpoint of change in body mass index from baseline to week 2, 4, and 6 during treatment and at weeks 4, 12, and week 24 after completion of treatment. The study will also compare the efficacy and safety of dTMS treatment to that of sham treatment. The authors conclude that the results of the proposed study may provide evidence for the development of a new treatment program for AN.

[/INST] The Expanded Newborn Screening as a Risk Assessment for Families study aims to investigate the acceptability of expanded newborn screening to parents in France with or without genetics in the first line. The study involves four different participant groups: parents or co-parents of a newborn child; parents or co-parents whose youngest child is between 1 week and 3 years old; parents or co-parents whose child was diagnosed with a suspicious result that was later confirmed as an increased risk for a rare disease; and, parents or co-parents whose child had a confirmed diagnosis of a disease not included in the list of screened diseases. The study uses mixed methods and a triangulation of results to explore four different dimensions of acceptability: affective attitude, burden, ethicality, and perceived effectiveness. The study is currently in the planning phase, and completion of enrollment is expected in November 2023.

[/INST] The study’s title is “Remote Tai Ji for Low Back Pain: a Randomized Trial” and it assesses the effectiveness of Tai Chi and Qigong Rehabilitation for chronic back pain. The study is open-label with randomized allocation over 2 groups of 19 participants each with the intervention group receiving Tai-Chi Qigong Rehabilitation, and the control group receiving usual care. The evaluation period is 21 months, and the study’s primary outcome measure is the Oswestry Disability Index, while the secondary outcome measures are Back Pain Visual Assessment Scale, VAS Leg Pain, SF-36 Quality of Life Scale, and Quality of Sleep Index. The two study groups’ demographic data are provided in the study. The trial is registered with number PRS1202208, and the trial protocol was published in 2022.

[/INST] The study is an observational cohort study of people living with HIV treated with CD19-directed CAR T cell therapy for B-cell malignancies. The purpose of the study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of CAR T cell therapy in HIV patients. The study will collect and analyze clinical information such as toxicity, CD4/ absolute lymphocyte count, HIV viral load, and response to therapy. The primary outcome is the rate of toxicities related to CAR19 therapy within 12 months from baseline, while secondary outcomes include the change in CD4 count, absolute lymphocyte count, HIV viral load, and overall response to therapy.

[/INST] Pearl Therapeutics is conducting the Prospective Evaluation of AI R&D Tool for Patient Stratification - Mechanism of Action Evaluation in Triple Negative Breast Cancer (PEAR-MET) trial to recruit patients with advanced or metastatic TNBC. The trial will enroll patients who are due to start a new line of systemic therapy, such as a targeted drug or immunotherapy, and who have undergone a biopsy and given 40 ml of blood. Their trial has several objectives, which include establishing the correct dose of each FDA-approved therapeutic or combination of therapies in the Pear Bio system. They will also investigate the positive predictive value of Pear image-based biomarkers in predicting a pathological complete response, as well as the performance of biomarkers in predicting progression-free and overall survival. They expect to complete the study within 2 years.

[/INST] The article "Delayed Surgery in Inflammatory Bowel Disease" is a health economic analysis, which includes the quality of life for inflammatory bowel diseases. The aim of the study is to investigate the effect of delayed surgery on health costs and quality of life for patients with inflammatory bowel diseases. The study compares a group of patients who underwent delayed surgery with a group of patients who underwent immediate surgery. The primary outcome is the effect of delayed surgery on health costs and quality of life. The secondary outcome of the study is socioeconomic characteristics of patients who underwent delayed surgery. The study will be conducted over a six-year period from 2021 to 2027. The study has a hypothetical design, which means that the patients in the study will not be treated, but fictional treatment scenarios will be compared with a reference group. The study will include patients with inflammatory bowel disease who are waiting for elective surgery at Sahlgrenska University Hospital. The patients in this group will be compared with patients who underwent immediate surgery during the study period.

[/INST] The summary for the trial titled “Role of myeloid-derived suppressive cells (MDSCs) and cancer stem cells and their cross-talks in non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)” is as follows: The aim of this project is to better characterize the non-immunological pro-tumor functions of MDSC isolated from patients with lung cancer and how CSC populations could cross-talk with MDSC in NSCLC tumors. Resected NSCLC samples from patients will be used to purify, with the flow cytometry system, the different tumor immune infiltrates. Isolated immune cells will be cultured under specific culture condition and analyzed in functional experiments to measure their effects on the proliferation, invasion and apoptosis of NSCLC cell lines. In addition, conditioned media (CM) will be prepared from MDSCs and tested on both tumor cell growth and invasion. Data, obtained from the isolation and functional assays, will be analyzed with R, a specific software program, and statistical analysis of paired-samples will be performed. The study includes 20 consecutive patients, with resected NSCLC, who will be monitored for recruitment and sample inclusion.

[/INST] Glucose concentrations and liking for sugar-sweetened beverages will be investigated after a sugary drink intervention with sparkling water. Study participants will be assigned to an experimental group where they will be asked to replace sugar-sweetened beverages with unsweetened flavored sparkling water and track their consumption using an app. Dietary consumption of sparkling water and sugar-sweetened beverages, 2-h glucose concentrations, insulin sensitivity and other measures will be assessed. The study will investigate whether substituting diet drink for SSB could reduce liking for sweetness, improve insulin sensitivity, and be palatable. Results could help people reduce sugar intake from SSB to prevent health problems, including obesity and diabetes.

[/INST] The Novosyn® Quick Suture Material is used in resective periodontal surgery to assess the early wound healing score (EHS) and its ability to enhance postoperative wound healing in terms of edema, gingival bleeding, necrosis, and dryness. The Novosyn® Quick Suture Material also evaluates intraoperative and post-operative patient satisfaction. Data from the study are collected using a questionnaire. The study excludes pregnant or breastfeeding women and those taking medication that affects wound healing or has allergies to the suture material. The evaluation of EHS and the ability of the Novosyn® Quick Suture Material to promote postoperative wound healing is performed in 10 ± 5 days after the resective periodontal surgery. Statistical analysis is done using descriptive and inferential statistics. The power of the test is 80%, and the alpha value is set at 0.05. The p-value is less than 0.05, which indicates significant EHS score differences between Novosyn Quick® and Monosyn Quick groups.

[/INST] The study aimed to evaluate the efficacy of coenzyme I in injection for the treatment of sudden sensorineural hearing loss (SSNHL) in adults. The study recruited 60 patients with SSNHL, who were assigned to either an experimental group that received conventional treatment with coenzyme I for injection or a control group that received conventional treatment only. After a 14-day treatment, pure tone average was measured using pure tone audiometry, speech recognition rate was assessed using the Tinnitus Handicap Inventory, and subjective loudness and stuffiness were recorded using Visual Analogue Scale. The results showed significant improvement in all measured outcomes, and the experimental group showed better improvements than the control group in some aspects. However, there were no significant differences in tinnitus score between the two groups. Overall, the study suggests that coenzyme I in injection may be an effective adjunctive treatment for SSNHL.

[/INST] The study entitled "Scientific Basis for a Newborn Screening for Cystinosis and Primary Hyperoxaluria" aims to evaluate the molecular-based NBS for cystinosis and primary hyperoxaluria (PH). The study will evaluate whether the inclusion of these diseases into general NBS is recommended. To this end, newborns born in hospitals participating in the study will have a screening test for cystinosis and PH included in the regular NBS. In detail, NBS will include multiplex PCR to detect 2/3 of the most common CTNS mutations, and whole-genome sequencing (WGS) to identify 175 cystinosis variants. Patients will be sent to one of the centers of reference in Germany or the laboratory in Mainz for confirmation testing. Confirmation testing for cystinosis must be performed by measuring the cystine value in white blood cells within the first 72 hours of life. If both CTNS mutations are homozygous, compound heterozygous, or c.18_21delGACT p.T7Ffs*7 homozygous and elevated cystine values are detected, the NBS for cystinosis is positive. For PH, confirmatory testing is performed by measuring urine oxalate concentration in the first 56 days of life. Genetically confirmed patients with cystinosis or PH will be classified as true positives. The results will be sent to the participating centers, informing parents on the child's condition. An in-depth discussion will assess the results for treatment. The pilot project started on 1 July 2021 and aims to include a total of 200,000 babies in the screening. The scientific data and ethical basis for the inclusion of cystinosis and PH in the newborn screening panel will be evaluated, and it will be demonstrated how the screening for cystinosis and PH by newborn screening can be performed.

[/INST] This study will be a randomized clinical trial to assess the comparative effects of flexibility and resistance training on symptoms, self-efficacy, and maternal quality of life in postpartum depression. Participants will be divided into two groups: resistance training or flexibility training group. Data will be collected using the Exercises self-efficacy scale, the Epidemiological studies Depression scale (CES-D), and the Maternal Postpartum Quality Life Questionnaire (MAPP-QOL) as subjective measurements. The study is conducted over 8 weeks.

Both of these arms were to be used for 3 and 6 months for each patient. There were 3 measures in the outcome measures. 2D, 3D wear of denture teeth were measured using denture scanning and superimposition of the sanning at insertion to that after three and 6 months. The measurement of surface hardness was done using Vickers's test. This measurement was done at insertion and after 6 months.

[/INST] This is a clinical trial that compares the effects of using different anesthetics on the prognosis of primary brain, lung, liver, and ovarian tumors and their underlying mechanisms. The use of inhaled anesthetic sevoflurane or propofol as an anesthetic may affect tumor recurrence, treatment progression, tumor-related mortality, overall mortality, and Karnofsky performance status in patients undergoing primary tumor removal surgery. The study will assess the prognostic effects of propofol and sevoflurane in patients who undergo resection surgery for primary brain, lung, ovarian, and liver cancers within thirty days after surgery 6 months, 1 year, or 3 years post-surgery.

[/INST] The purpose of the study is to develop and evaluate a dissemination and implementation plan for a new curriculum content to improve physical activity-related health competence (PAHCO) of nursing students. The researchers in this study will combine cooperative planning with expert-based strategies to develop and refine the curriculum content and strategies. Furthermore, they will evaluate their effectiveness by implementing the new curriculum content and comparing the outcomes with those of the control group students who did not receive any new curriculum content. The primary outcome of the study will be student’s knowledge and behavior regarding physical activity and health, while the secondary outcomes include physical and mental health and work ability. The study will run for 14 months and measure outcomes at baseline and 2 and 12-month follow-up periods. The study population is nursing students attending theoretical training programs for 2 or 3 days per week who will complete self-reported instruments. The researchers expect to see more benefits of the new curriculum content than of the control group on health-related aspects, physical and mental well-being, and work ability.

[/INST] The title 'Effect of Diosmin/Hespiridin Combination on the Clinical Outcomes in Patients with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome' (PCOS) was chosen to summarize the main objective of the study which is to evaluate the effect of combining daflon and COCs on patients with PCOS. The keywords included in the title and abstract help to index the full paper with terms related to the study. The clinical trial is an RCT with three parallel arms (groups): Arm 1: Diosmin/Hesperidin + Combined oral contraceptive (Combined oral contraceptive) (reference); Arm 2: Diosmin/Hesperidin + Metformin + Combined oral contraceptive (Diosmin/Hesperidin + Metformin + Combined oral contraceptive) (experimental); and Arm 3: Diosmin/Hesperidin + Metformin + Combined oral contraceptive (reference).

[/INST] The investigators propose to use Cetuximab-IRDye800 labeling, an optical imaging method, for the intraoperative detection of cancerous lung nodules. This method could help surgeons improve the accuracy of lung resection in cancer patients, leading to higher rates of negative surgical margins and better patient outcomes. The use of this method for lung cancer has been effective in animal models and has resulted in a higher rate of negative surgical margins in patients undergoing treatment for salivary gland tumors.

[/INST] Standard Versus Prolonged Antibiotic Prophylaxis After Pancreatoduodenectomy (SPARROW) - ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier: NCT00926767 - Study Start Date: 1 January 2008 - Primary Completion Date: 30 November 2012 - Primary Purpose: Treatment - Phase: Phase 3 - Intervention: Cefuroxime, Metronidazole - Intervention Name: Prolonged Antibiotic Prophylaxis - Recruitment Status: Recruiting - Clinical Condition: Pancreatic Cancer - Design: Randomized Control Trial - Proposals Start Date: 1 September 2007 - Referral Date: 11 October 2007 - Referral Type of Authorization: RBH

[/INST] This clinical study is a phase 2 basket trial assessing the combination of sotorasib, an oral KRAS G12C-selective small-molecule inhibitor, with Panitumumab, an intravenous monoclonal antibody against Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR). Patients with advanced solid tumors that have a KRAS G12C mutation are eligible to participate in this trial. The primary outcome measure is the objective response rate based on Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECIST v1.1) at the imaging tumor assessment timepoint after Cycle 1 (Day 1) (each cycle is 14 days). Other secondary outcome measures include median Progression-Free Survival (PFS), Overall Survival (OS), median Time to Progression, Overall Response Rate (ORR), and safety assessment. The combination of KRAS G12C-selective small-molecule inhibitor, such as sotorasib, with EGFR-targeting antibody, such as Panitumumab, is potentially beneficial for patients with KRAS G12C-mutant solid tumors.

[/INST] This is a controlled, parallel clinical trial comparing two groups of patients with single gingival recession associated with non-carious cervical lesion partially restored due to non-restorative caries or abrasion: one group receiving the Volume-stable Collagen Matrix and the other group receiving only the restorative procedure. The trial has two follow-up periods and consists in monitoring the reduction in recession height, root hypersensitivity, a number of combined defects completely covered, the patients' oral health impact profile and comfort, using several clinical and visual scale measures.

[/INST] Our study objective was to investigate the effects of different nutritional support models based on nutritional risk screening on gastrointestinal cancer patients undergoing surgery. To achieve this, we compared the nutritional interventions of the study group (NRS 2002 ≥ 3 and PG-SGA ≥ 4) with the control group (NRS 2002 < 3 and PG-SGA < 4). Our results were consistent with our hypothesis that the nutritional intervention group had higher nutritional status and better nutritional rehabilitation than the control group.

[/INST] The study Effect of the Abutment-Prosthesis Connection on Marginal Bone Loss and Gingival Sealing Around Dental Implants aims to compare the effectiveness of a Connect® abutment to a conventional multi-unit abutment for implant-supported tooth restorations. The study seeks to determine whether using a Connect® abutment can improve peri-implant marginal bone levels, inflammation, and microbiome after restoring multiple implants compared to a conventional multi-unit connection. The study will recruit 96 partially edentulous subjects and implant 6 implants in the mandible. All participants will be followed for one year and receive the same implant type. At the one-year follow-up, the implants will be reassessed, and measurements taken to evaluate peri-implant marginal bone height, microbiome, and inflammation.

[/INST] This clinical trial is evaluating the clinical efficacy of a conventional transcranial Doppler probe and a wearable ultrasound patch device for non-invasive monitoring of cerebral blood flow. Approximately 60 volunteers are required to be recruited for the study. A comparison of ultrasound patch and conventional transcranial Doppler probe will be based on the following primary outcome measures: device comparison to standard monitoring, time duration, feasibility of the study participants to use the device, pain during the procedure, and image quality.

[/INST] The Summary section in a clinical trial report should provide an overall description of the trial, including the key objectives, population, interventions, methods, and outcomes.It should be concise and accurate, capturing the core elements of the trial in a manner that supports clinical decision-making.

[/INST] The selected article titled  “Adjuvant Therapy for High-risk Hepatocellular Carcinoma Post Liver Transplantation” by author Qinmei Yin describes the design of a phase III, multicenter, randomized controlled trial to investigate the effects of a combination therapy of multi-kinase inhibitor (SOR, LEN or DON) with Bevacizumab as adjuvant therapy in patients with HCC and high-risk recurrence factors. This study will be conducted for a period of 8.6 year  from January 1, 2018 to December 31, 2026.

[/INST] This review aims to explore current research on psychological treatments in transgender affirmation therapy. It suggests some treatments may help with depression and anxiety. One reason for this could be the opportunity to discuss affirmation issues in therapy, and the therapist being accepting. Some patients may feel less distressed talking about affirmation issues. The review says more research is needed.

[/INST] Coagulation Parameters With Albumin in Decompensated Cirrhosis (CoPA-D). The trial included decompensated cirrhosis patients with significant albumin decrease from 2.5 g/dl. Patients were randomly assigned to albumin infusion or standard care. Both groups were treated based on standard of care. The albumin group had a higher level of albumin than the standard care group at the end of the study. Additionally, there was a notable improvement in coagulation parameters in patients receiving albumin therapy. The improvement in coagulation was seen on day 1 of the study. The study found that albumin administration significantly improved coagulation parameters. However, the primary aim of the study was not met as there was no significant reduction in PT in albumin group compared to standard care group. On the other hand, albumin infusion is related to an increase in fibrinogen values. There were no reported adverse effects because of the albumin infusion.

[/INST] In this prospective study, 65 patients with potentially operable non-small cell lung cancer without driving gene EGFR/ALK mutation in stage III were enrolled for 1 year, followed up for 2 years, and the study lasted for 3 years.Patients were followed up for 2 years according to the standard diagnosis and treatment path, with a total of 9 times of follow-up, and the follow-up examination was conducted in accordance with clinical standards.For all patients, the primary outcomes were the prognostic value of MRD testing before and after surgery and the safety of the test. [/INST] The trial is a pilot trial comparing the two arms surgery only and surgery plus laparoscopy for treating the ulcerative and necrotic enterocolitis in preterm neonates who have undergone surgery. The secondary outcomes include postoperative mortality, postoperative biological inflammatory response, postoperative intestinal morbidity (stoma rate, duration of parenteral nutrition, duration of hemodynamic support, duration of invasive ventilation (high frequency oscillatory ventilation/synchronized intermittent mandatory ventilation), rate of intestinal stenosis, postoperative reoperation rate, length of hospital stay up to 3 months, and medium-term postoperative neurological morbidity.

[/INST] This is a randomized controlled trial of hair removal in the axilla for women, comparing intense pulsed light and diode laser. The sessions frequency will be once per month for 4 sessions, totaling 4 treatments. There will be 30-day and 6-month follow-ups after the end of treatment .

[/INST] The objective of the PROMISE-BD-100 study is to track infarct progression trajectories and to identify key characteristics associated with BD-tau levels after admission in patients with an acute ischemic stroke. To accomplish this, BD-tau levels are measured every hour from admission up to 48 hours after stroke onset.

[/INST] This clinical trial study sought to investigate the effectiveness of artificial intelligence in improving radiologists' skills in mastering the thyroid imaging reporting and data system of contrast-enhanced ultrasound of thyroid nodules. For the training set, patients who underwent contrast-enhanced ultrasounds and ultrasound-guided fine-needle aspiration from January 2018 to December 2020 at Sun Yat-sen Memorial Hospital were included. The internal test set included patients who underwent the same examinations from January 2021 to May 2023 at Sun Yat-sen Memorial Hospital, while the external test set contained patients who received the same examinations from January 2022 to June 2023 at both Houjie Hospital of Dongguan and Central People's Hospital of Zhanjiang. The radiologists in this study were required to develop 126 ultrasound features, and artificial intelligence was used to help them achieve this. At the end of the first, third, and sixth months of training, the area under the curve of the thyroid nodules' receiver operating characteristic curve was used to assess the diagnostic performance, and the faculty who were responsible for the training program evaluated the skills of the radiologists to determine the number of cases they completed during the first, third, and sixth months.

[/INST] The investigators will determine the ability of patients implanted with retinal prostheses to detect and discriminate stimuli and use this knowledge to create stimulation strategies that improve visual perception and scene understanding. Participants will be implanted with visual prostheses that directly stimulate the neurons of the retina. Once implanted, subjects will be asked to perform specific tasks to determine their ability to perceive and understand the visual scene after the stimulation. The investigators will measure performance and use these data to determine the best stimulation strategy to improve visual perception and scene understanding.

[/INST] This is a clinical trial by Brigham and Women's Hospital on surveillance of regional nodal basins of primary high risk cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck. The study included three groups of patients based on their Tumor, Node, Metastasis (TNM) Staging. The group includes BWH stage T2a tumors in patients who are on chronic immunosuppression[Group 1], BWH stage T2b[Group 2], and BWH stage T3[Group 3]. Group 1 will be examined every six months for two years with no intervention or additional imaging. Group 2 will be examined via CT scan at enrollment and SLNB if the CT is positive. If the SLNB comes back negative, the patients will be entered into the study and undergo surveillance every six months for two years. Group 3 will be examined as in Group 2. The primary outcome of this study is to evaluate the number of participants with nodal metastasis in all three groups. The study found that there was a significantly lesser number of regional nodal recurrences in the study group with US or SLNB when compared with the control group of patients without US surveillance at each time point 9., 18 and 24 months.

[/INST] Aim To study the biochemical profile of GER and GERD infants and its correlation to food intake. The biochemical profile of saliva includes the study of circadian pepsin and pepsinogen concentrations, and sodium and HCO3- electrolytes.

[/INST] The trial titled "Novel Antidiabetic Medications and Their Effect on Liver Steatosis (NAMELS-18)" is a one-year study comparing the effect of subcutaneous Dulaglutide and oral Empagliflozin on liver steatosis in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM). The trial also compares the effect of Empagliflozin and Dulaglutide with standard care treatment. The trial will recruit 180 participants with diabetes and liver steatosis of NAFLD and will compare the baseline parameters such as liver fat fraction, fatty liver index (FLI), fibrosis 4 (FIB-4), aspartate transaminase to platelet ratio index (APRI), HbA1c, body mass index and serum parameters to the values at 52 weeks. Overall, it can be stated that the main objective of the study is to measure the change of liver fat fraction in patients diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus. The outcomes of this trial will provide robust evidence regarding the effect of anti-HbA1c molecules on liver steatosis in patients with diabetes mellitus.

[/INST] The clinical trial is a randomized clinical trial testing the feasibility of surgical exposure of palatally impacted upper canines with open-eruption technique using a surgical template. The primary outcome measures include success of surgery and success of open eruption technique. The secondary outcomes are surplus costs of surgical planning and applying surgical guides, the duration of surgery, postoperative pain, and incidence of complications. The trial will follow up with the patients for a period of one year. The patients will be examined intraorally.

[/INST] The study investigates a type of therapy called CAVEAT that addresses post-traumatic mothers to change their perception of their infants. This therapy consists of videotaped interaction between a mother and her infant and then playback. The hypothesis is that with this type of therapy, the mother will have a better perception of her infant, will respond better to its needs, and will be less in a state of hyperarousal. Parents' and therapists' satisfaction with therapy is measured to evaluate the feasibility of this therapy.

[/INST] The "Harnessing Human Potential and Improving Health Span in Women and Their Children (HAPPY STUDY)" is a randomized clinical trial that aims to test the effectiveness of a holistic lifestyle digital intervention on pre-diabetes and T2D prevention. The intervention is based on 3 pillars: diet, physical activity, and mental well-being. The study has three major objectives: 1) reduce the risk of T2D and pre-diabetes in Asian women and their children; 2) identify post-GDM women and those with increased risk of diabetes; and 3) evaluate the impact of the digital health innovation on outcomes such as changes in glucose regulation, cardiometabolic variables, body composition, mental well-being in subjects, and children's health. The study used an app for smartphones (LVL-UP) and an activity-tracking wearable that collects lifestyle data (Oura ring and Oura app), and aims to assess the app's impact on lifestyle habits. The population consists of post-GDM women, who were identified using the health records in public and private hospitals. Participants must be aged 21-45 years, Malaysian Chinese, Indian, or Singaporean Chinese ethnicity, with a BMI of 18.5-35 kg/m2, living in Singapore for at least 1 year, and able to read and understand English.

[/INST] Pediatric patients are randomly assigned to three groups: dry heat, dry cold, and control. Dry heat or dry cold applications are performed before blood sampling and are then compared to the control group. A number of questionnaires are used to evaluate the patients' pain, anxiety, and fear levels, such as the Wong Baker Faces Pain Scale, Child Fear Anxiety Scale, and Medical Procedures Fear Inventory. The effect of dry heat and dry cold stimulations before blood draw on pain, fear, and anxiety levels are measured.

[/INST] Title: Chemoreduction With Transarterial Melphalan in Large Primary Uveal Melanoma: Study Protocol for the Melphalan Chemoreduction for Ocular MelanomA (MELCOM) Trial. Abstract: Large primary uveal melanomas are associated with increased risks of local extension and metastatic disease. In order to achieve tumor reductive before performing plaque brachytherapy, we proposed a primary ocular melanoma treatment called choroidal melanoma chemoreduction with transarterial melphalan (MELCOM), using melphalan intra-arterial chemotherapy. The primary objective is to determine the efficacy and safety of this therapy. Secondary objectives include tumor size reduction, visual acuity maintenance, electroretinogram (ERG) improvement, and intra-ocular inflammation delay. The study should be conducted at a single center hospital in Brazil to enroll patients with large primary uveal melanomas and should demonstrate the efficacy of melphalan chemoreduction in this scenario.

[/INST] The study is a retrospective observational trial conducted in a general hospital in Colombia. The aim is to establish a trauma registry and describe the characteristics, severity, and outcomes of patients admitted to the emergency ward by trauma from January to June 2023. The registry includes patients with non-penetrating injuries (falls, car accidents, and other blunt mechanisms), penetrating injuries (caused by objects penetrating the skin), and patients with one or more traumatic injuries. The outcomes of the study will include demographic, clinical, and treatment data, the number of patients who died in the hospital during discharge or the first 28 days after hospitalization, the length of hospitalization (days), the need for ICU, the length of ICU stay (days), the need for mechanical ventilation, and the length of mechanical ventilation (days).

[/INST] The Lumbosacral Spinal Stenosis - Non-Invasive Postural Therapy for Older Adult Veterans (LSS-NIPT) study examines whether a coordinated suite of Durable Medical Equipment (DME) and training to support continuous maintenance of flexion posture can help those with lumbar spinal stenosis in the process of rehabilitation. Throughout the trial, participants are asked to wear actigraphs intermittently and to complete several assessments and questionnaires such as pain scale, a test of 50-feet-long walk, and the two-minute walk test. Primary outcomes are an increase in mobility at week 6 compared to baseline. The trial also allows for the collection of a wide range of health information using genetic, imaging, and electronic health record data to develop and test a risk score model to predict progress in the process of rehabilitation for spine surgery.

[/INST] A study is being conducted on a crossover design to assess the effects of self-administered nitrous oxide (SANO) on urodynamic study (UDS) parameters, pain, and anxiety. The study involves patients aged 21 to 85 years who require UDS and are willing to undergo two UDS runs during the procedure. The intervention is either self-administered nitrous oxide (SANO) or oxygen. The experimental arms are SANO (1), oxygen (2), and oxygen (1), nitrous oxide (SANO) (2). The primary outcome is bladder capacity measured in milliliters at time of max fill during urodynamic study, and secondary outcomes include intra-Urodynamic Study pain and anxiety.

[/INST] This study is a secondary analysis that used the data obtained in a project that investigated the relationship between Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs), epigenetics, and resilience. The study recruited 38 women who had breast cancer and had finished their treatment. The participants filled in questionnaires on Quality of Life (QoL), fatigue, anxiety and depression, attachment, ACEs, Resilience, and resting RMSSD (root mean square of successive differences between normal heartbeats) values. The participants were divided into groups based on ACE score and genetic data. The analysis showed that quality of life and ACEs were related to each other, as were anxiety/depression and fatigue. Resting RMSSD was higher for the women who reported high levels of ACEs. The women who reported low levels of ACEs showed higher levels of resilience. Based on the findings of the study, ACEs can increase the patient's morbidity and healthcare related costs by affecting the patient's QoL, and can also reduce their resilience.

[/INST] The trial is a single centre crossover trial evaluating the effectiveness of the AI-assisted polyp detector in clinical setting while comparing experts and non-experts endoscopists. The study will involve adult patients > 45 years of age referred for routine screening colonoscopy. In a single session, each patient will undergo two colonoscopies, HD-colonoscopy followed by HD-colonoscopy assisted by AI (10 min later). The expert and non-expert endoscopists who will perform the HD-colonoscopy will be blinded from the AI-detector results. The data generated from the study will be analyzed and compared between the expert and non-expert endoscopists using AI-assisted colonoscopy.

[/INST] "Low-carb diets reduce seizure frequency in epileptic patients with a low risk for hypoglycemia (Le Poul et al., 2022; Kahashi et al., 2012; Lutas & Yellen, 2018; Kossoff & Dorner, 2016; Helmu et al., n.d.; Kossoff & Hu, 2020; Avolaiti et al., 2019). A low-glycemic index (LGI) diet is one of the most flexible diets, which, in combination with a low-carb ketogenic diet, has been shown to improve seizure control in people with epilepsy (Yavstrongin et al., 2022; Kim et al., 2016; Sander et al., 2016). The objective of this clinical trial is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of implementing a low glycemic index (LGI) diet in pregnant women with epilepsy. The participants will be randomly assigned to either a control group or experimental group. Those in the experimental group will receive information about the LGI diet and ongoing support from a dietician. Stool and blood samples will be collected before and after the intervention to assess the participants' gut bacteria and metabolic pathways. The participants' seizure frequency and infant outcomes will be monitored to evaluate the efficacy and safety of the LGI diet in pregnant women with epilepsy. The findings of this clinical trial may lead to the development of new dietary guidelines for pregnant women with epilepsy, highlighting the effectiveness of the LGI diet."

[/INST] The study is a single-arm, open-label pilot trial for mesothelin-targeted CAR-T Cells as a Neo-adjuvant Treatment in Patients With Resectable Pancreatic Cancers: a Feasibility Study. The primary outcome measure of the study is to evaluate the proportion of major pathologic response to pancreatic cancer on resected specimens. The secondary outcome measures included radiological response according to RECIST 1.1 of tumor volumetric reduction at trial entry and 4 weeks after MSLN CAR-T injection, rate of R0 surgical resection, incidence rate of serious adverse events of grade III and above, disease-free and overall survival.

[/INST] The  clinical trial examines the effectiveness of a web-based decision support system (DSS) called TREAT (TREatment Adherence SupporT) in enhancing cancer treatment adherence among patients with metastatic breast cancer. The TREAT DSS is designed to provide information on various aspects of metastatic breast cancer, including physical and psychological consequences and available interventions, as well as personalized recommendations. It also includes a medication adherence reminder feature and an adherence evaluation component. The trial aims to assess the impact of using the TREAT DSS on adherence to oral anticancer treatments over a three-month period. The primary endpoint is the overall adherence to OAT. The trial uses randomized controlled methodology to measure the effectiveness of the DSS.

All participants or their parents/guardians will be asked to complete the Pediatric Balance Scale to measure the secondary outcome of dynamic balance at baseline and after 4 weeks of intervention. The trial will evaluate two types of exercises: weight bearing exercises and weight bearing exercises combined with

[/INST] In this randomized study, subjects with chronic kidney disease will either receive Melatonin (5 mg), a synthetic form of the hormone, produced in the brain. Melatonin, as a protein in animal nutrition, has gained attention due to its ability to improve animal health, meat quality, and reproductive performance. Studies have indicated melatonin as a potent antioxidant hormone in human and animal models. Since its absorption in the intestine is not certain and can vary significantly among individuals, in this study, Melatonin will be supplemented by consuming tablets before going to bed. Melatonin is a common dietary supplement used to treat jet lag, sleep problems, and depression. Participants will be recruited after passing inclusion and exclusion criteria and informed consent. Healthy men and women without medical conditions, taking medications that significantly alter melatonin levels, or taking any medications for sleep problems will be recruited. The number of participants will be 80. They are not be followed up for their physical or cognitive activities and changes in their body fat composition and bone mineral distribution. The total time of follow up will be 10 weeks. Participants will be asked to take three daily oral medications. They will be evaluated for quality of life, kidney disease, depression, and sleep quality. Participants will also perform 24-hour urine and blood samples tests to determine the amount of melatonin in their body. The results of this study will add new insights into the use of melatonin supplements in human disease applications.

[/INST] This is a parallel group, single-arm, prospective monocentric exploratory trial that will enroll patients undergoing elective cardiac surgery under cardiopulmonary bypass at the university hospital of Lille, France. The trial will evaluate the optimization of perioperative management and oxygen delivery in patients undergoing cardiac surgery with the aim of improving clinical outcomes and reducing postoperative adverse effects. The optimization strategy will be provided by the use of the CONNECT system (O3 Medical, Lima, USA) during cardiopulmonary bypass, which will combine real-time cardiac output monitoring with pulse oximetry and blood lactate monitoring. The trial will enroll 150 patients aged over 18 years scheduled for elective cardiac surgery. Inclusion criteria are age, written informed consent, French social security coverage, and scheduled for elective cardiac surgery under CPB. Exclusion criteria include pregnancy and breastfeeding, emergency surgery, infectious endocarditis, aortic dissection, cardiac transplantation, LVAD insertion, and uncontrolled sepsis.

[/INST] The purpose of this study is to investigate the impact of kidney point auricular acupressure on lumbar region temperature in healthy volunteers by using infrared thermal imaging. This is a randomized, triple-blinded, and crossover study. Participants will be assigned to two groups, and each group will receive left ear kidney point auricular acupressure (AA) first followed by right ear kidney point sham auricular acupressure (SA) (AA-SA group), while the other will receive SA first followed by AA (SA-AA group). The temperature changes in the left and right lumbar region will be recorded using an infrared thermal imaging camera during the procedure. The primary outcome measure is the change in temperature of the left lumbar region during AA, and the secondary outcome measure is the change in temperature of the right lumbar region during the procedure. The proportions of auricular therapy side effects will also be recorded.

[/INST] Background: Patients undergoing cardiac surgery often develop hemodynamic instability during weaning from cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB). The goal of tissue perfusion is to ensure adequate cardiac output and peripheral oxygen delivery. However, there is paucity of data available to help cardiac anesthesiologists identify patients who may develop hemodynamic instability during weaning from CPB. It is therefore crucial to develop a reliable method to identify such patients before they develop clinical instability.

[/INST] This is a prospective observational study of the acute and subacute effects of furosemide injection in individuals with heart failure. 80 mg of furosemide is administered intravenously, and several measures are taken, including blood pressure, peripheral oxygen saturation, measurement of pulmonary fluid content using remote dielectric sensing (ReDS), an ultrasound examination of the heart and lungs, and assessment of filling pressures using doppler echocardiography and strain analyses. These measures are repeated at several time points until 6 hours have elapsed. The primary outcome is the change in pulmonary fluid content after administering furosemide. Acute heart failure, systolic blood pressure ≥100 mmHg, age ≥18 years, an oxygen saturation <94% or need for oxygen, the existence of pulmonary congestion on an x-ray or ReDS, and a confirmed systolic blood pressure ≥100 mmHg are all inclusion criteria for the study. Participants were excluded if they had previously received a dose of furosemide >40 mg within the previous 3 hours, or if they possessed any of the other exclusion criteria listed above. The recruitment for the study has ended, and the results of this trial remain unpublished.

[/INST] This study aims to evaluate the effect of a smartphone application on binge drinking among university students. The study will be a randomized controlled trial conducted in Quebec, Canada. The app to be used in the study was previously developed by our team. Participants aged 18 to 25 years with binge drinking behavior and an AUDIT score of at least 24 will be recruited to compare the effect of using the app to those who do not receive it. Follow-up will be for 30 months, during which the number of drinks taken per week will be monitored through the app. Participants' blood samples will be collected before and after the evaluation period to measure the concentration of phosphatidylcholine and alcohol blood levels. The results will allow us to determine the effectiveness of the smartphone application in preventing binge drinking. The study's protocol will be followed to minimize bias and ensure data quality. The study's findings may lead to more effective and accessible interventions to reduce binge drinking.

[/INST] This clinical trial aims to evaluate the effectiveness of nitazoxanide as an adjuvant therapy to current treatments for type 2 diabetes mellitus, including metformin and dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitors (such as vildagliptin). The study duration is 12 weeks and requires a minimum level of glycated hemoglobin between 7% and 9% for eligible patients. The study is placebo-controlled and divided into two groups of 35 patients each. Group 1 patients received current treatments (metformin and dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitors (such as vildagliptin)), and Group 2 patients received nitazoxanide in addition to current treatments.

[/INST] Autism spectrum disorder (ASD) is a group of neurodevelopmental disorders. In this study, Gut microbiome dysbiosis is investigated in 40 autistic Egyptian children. The aim of this study is to investigate clinical risk factors of autism and to elucidate the changes in gut microbiome in Egyptian autistic children and their possible association with clinical outcomes and the severity of the disease.

[/INST] The study aims to develop an online self-help program to improve financial self-efficacy and financial well-being among adults with severe mental illness and to test the program’s efficacy through a randomized controlled trial with a wait-list control group. The program content includes money management and financial well-being concepts, financial knowledge and skills, and risk of financial exploitation. The four-week program is delivered through 4 weekly sessions, each module consists of an interactive video, quiz, and homework. The online platform was developed based on the Model of Human Occupation (MOHO), a theoretical framework integrating physical, cognitive, and interpersonal functions, and the MOHO concepts were incorporated in the online program. The study findings will provide evidence for the program’s efficacy in improving financial self-efficacy and financial well-being and inform future program development and implementation for people with severe mental illness.

[/INST] Summary: The research study titled "Effectiveness of START (Startle Adjuvant Rehabilitation Therapy) in Enhancing Arm Function Post-Stroke" is important because, if successful, it could lead to a more effective and affordable rehabilitation therapy for people with severe stroke. The key feature of the study is the use of a novel treatment that involves pairing a loud startle noise with physical therapy exercises. The study involves testing two different groups of participants: one group will receive the startle treatment and another control group will receive a similar treatment without the startle noise, to test the effectiveness of the intervention. The measures to evaluate the success of the intervention include changes in muscle activity, movement, functional tasks, as well as patient-reported outcomes, all of which will be measured before and after intervention. This study addresses a significant issue in stroke rehabilitation by looking for an effective and inexpensive intervention that is effective for people with severe stroke. This can improve the lives of many stroke patients in the future.

[/INST] This study is a single-arm trial exploring the effects of endoscopic lung volume reduction (ELVR) on diaphragmatic function and conformation in patients with COPD, as measured by transdiaphragmatic pressure (Pdi) and diaphragm computer tomography (CT). All included patients will undergo endobronchial valves placement, followed by pre- and 3-month post-measurements.

[/INST] The study entitled “Two-year Clinical Performance of Dual- and Light-cure Bulk-fill Resin Composites in Class ӀӀ Restorations: A Randomized Clinical Trial" is a clinical trial with the primary purpose of assessing the clinical performance of bulk-fill resin composites. The study is double-blind and randomized, and it evaluates the esthetic, functional, and biological properties of the materials and their color change over time. The study includes a 2-year follow-up period. Three different types of bulk-fill resin composites are tested in 18 participants, and each participant receives three restorations, each with a different type of resin composite. The study also discusses specific and non-specific inclusion and exclusion criteria along with the methods used for evaluating the properties of the materials, such as scores for the FDI criteria. The main outcome used to evaluate the clinical performance of the bulk-fill composites is the overall score given by the participants at the follow-up visit. Other criteria, such as surface luster, occlusal color, fracture of material and retention, marginal adaptation, and radiographic examination, are also included. The clinical study is registered with the German Clinical Trials Register (DRKSID: DRKS00010916, Date of Registration: March 2016).

[/INST] NET RETREAT is a phase II clinical trial in patients with metastatic, well-differentiated midgut neuroendocrine tumors. After having previous disease progression on everolimus therapy, patients are randomized to receive either 177Lu-DOTATATE or everolimus. The 177Lu-DOTATATE is a systemic therapy, while everolimus is an oral treatment.

[/INST] This summary is about a clinical trial for the long-term safety, tolerability, and efficacy of subcutaneous doses of TransCon CNP administered once weekly in children with achondroplasia. The trial is divided into two parts: part one will recruit participants who have completed prior clinical trials with TransCon CNP, and part two will recruit participants who are new to the drug. All participants must be below the age of 16.

[/INST] The summary is: The study is a correlation analysis. The study intends to use correlation analysis to examine how illness perceptions, coping strategies, self-efficacy and HRQoL are related to each other in PAF patients. The participants are Chinese people with PAF. Quality of life will be measured using the SF-12 questionnaire, while HRQoL will be measured as a score out of 100 with higher scores indicating higher quality of life and a score of 0 indicating the lowest possible quality of life. The study will consider the relationship between illness perceptions, coping strategies and anxiety/depression in PAF patients to investigate whether there is an indirect effect between illness perceptions/coping strategies and HRQoL. This study is of observational study design.
